intro: Triumfetta canacorum, commonly known as the narrowleaf triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and the leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or arid environments.
